page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {EVIDENCE}Our area has surprisingly little evidence of man's occupation, before the Anglo Saxons, partly because the land was a wild forested marsh before then. Thus the only archaeological remains are scattered and usually associated with burials. {ROCK. }The rock beneath is clay laid down by the last Scandinavian glacier. {PREHISTORY.}The first settlers were Paeleolithic hunters.Little changed until the Romans arrived to find the Parisii still hunting. {ANGLES.}The early Norsemen drained the land and ploughed it.The Normans Wasted it but we are mentioned in the Domesday Book. Henry Bolingbroke_later Henry lV_and Edward lV both landed at Ravenspurne in 1399 and l471 respect_ ively,clearly the most important visitors to the area.
